intro: Ochrocarpos jumellei, commonly known as the white-leafed tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive white, waxy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a velvety texture, while its flowers are clustered in panicles. Ochrocarpos jumellei is adapted to the arid and semi-arid climates of its native habitat, showcasing resilience to drought conditions.
